text: Yeah, it's mostly to create a branch against release-1.5, put all the backported commits onto it, run benchmarks and pkg eval, look into the logs of those, merge when it looks fine, make a new PR that bumps the version. Merge it. Ping Alex to update website etc.

elements.text: Yeah, it's mostly to create a branch against release-1.5, put all the backported commits onto it, run benchmarks and pkg eval, look into the logs of those, merge when it looks fine, make a new PR that bumps the version. Merge it. Ping Alex to update website etc.

text: Do you manually merge them or do you have a script that does it and create the github comments

elements.text: Do you manually merge them or do you have a script that does it and create the github comments

text: You need to create a GITHUB_AUTH env var with a github token: <https://github.com/KristofferC/Backporter/blob/09d66d93271c0fa20768303a257b3ef3b6ba6efc/backporter.jl#L46>.

elements.text: You need to create a GITHUB_AUTH env var with a github token:

text: And then you need to be in the julia directory (git) when you run it at the correct branch.

elements.text: And then you need to be in the julia directory (git) when you run it at the correct branch.

text: It also doesn't work 100% so some manual fixups are needed sometimes

text: We should make Dilum or Sascha do this one time, and when they get tired of it, they’ll make a GH Action with a big button that just says “do release” that we can push
